title: How can the process of determining the truth help us in our search for knowledge? - Quora

response.answer_text: Original Query- How can the process of determining the truth help us in our search for knowledge? Well, let's look at parts… “process of determining the truth”- logic, reason and critical thinking? Or you trying to determine the truth using prayerful Bible research? The process and methodology of determining the truth is is important as the source material do you use as reference. Literally garbage in garbage out

When I was young, an old man asked me, “Where is the island?” I saw no island. “Well, then, what DO you see?” I saw only clouds, sky, and sea. “Find the cloud that does not move.” The sea, the sky, and the clouds are all true. It is my task to understand what is before me — and find the relationships of our changing world, in which we all live. The search for knowledge is stepwise. I find something that is true, and then I compare other things to this. I practice at life. I approach our world with watchfulness, prudence, and skill — or I reap the consequences of my inattention, foolishness, or incompetence. Then he asked, “Where will we land the boat?” I did not know. “We need the beach. We cannot land on the rocks. Find the spot on the bottom of the cloud that is lighter than the rest. There is the beach.” And so, we came to rest. That is the truth. And I had found new knowledge.

Determining truth is usually not cost effective for descion making since it is really difficult to obtain even for trivial facts. Regardless, if seeking truth is your primary goal then learning will at least be a secondary objective. Sometimes looking at both ends of the picture will get you a better view. Your looking for things that will help you learn more. Now just think about all the things that prevent learning.

Discovering the truth is half the equation. We then need to live in the light of what we've discovered. This is how truth is transformative. We discover that governments aren't responding effectively, adequately, to prevent catastrophic climate-change. How do we respond to this finding? Do we hold governments accountable or, do we ignore the fact? Is there a difference between truth, actuality and, a personal reality - the stories we live by? How does seeing complexities of knowledge become paralyzing?
